intro: Kallstroemia glabrata, commonly known as the smooth kallstroemia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Lythraceae family, which includes plants such as the poinsettia and the swamp mallow. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are opposite, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Kallstroemia glabrata thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands and along stream banks.
